definition: an area within a monastery or convent to which the religious are normally restricted

examples: young men and women choosing the cloister as a way of life

definition: a place or state of seclusion
examples: … the Internet broke out of its academic cloister and started cavorting in the mainstream.

definition: a covered passage on the side of a court usually having one side walled and the other an open arcade or colonnade
examples: The courtyard is surrounded with a cloister.

definition: to seclude from the world in or as if in a cloister
examples: a scientist who cloisters herself in a laboratory
policy makers are cloistered for the weekend, trying to stave off a default that they fear could trigger an international financial panic
